intro: Psychotria albidocalyx var. velutina, commonly known as velvet psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, thriving in the understory of tropical forests.
